info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 9:50PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Fergus and southern Blaine Counties through 1015 PM MDT... At 950 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 22 miles southwest of Zortman, moving west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Fergus and southern Blaine Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
